verses.text: 在以法蓮山地的拉瑪．瑣非，有一個以法蓮人名叫以利加拿，是耶羅罕的兒子、以利戶的孫子、託戶的曾孫、蘇弗的玄孫。

words.note: A person from Ephraim.
Lit. 'profound grandchild'.

verses.heading: Hannah Gives Birth to Samuel

verses.text: 他有兩個妻子，一個名叫哈拿，另一個名叫毗尼拿。毗尼拿有孩子，哈拿卻沒有孩子。
這人每年都從他的本城上示羅去敬拜，獻祭給萬軍之耶和華。在示羅有以利的兩個兒子，何弗尼和非尼哈，作耶和華的祭司。

words.note: Often used for religious worship.
Lit. 'offer sacrifice'.
Often used in 'Lord of Hosts'.
Classical Chinese possessive/linking particle.
Lit. 'manager of sacrifices'.

verses.text: 以利加拿在獻祭的那天，就把祭肉分給妻子毗尼拿和她所有的兒女。

words.note: Lit. 'offer sacrifice'.
Grammatical particle, 'Ba' construction.
Lit. 'sons and daughters'.

verses.text: 但他只分給哈拿一份；他雖然愛哈拿 （《馬索拉文本》意思不明確，「但他只分給哈拿一份；他雖然愛哈拿」或譯﹕「但他分給哈拿雙份，因為他愛哈拿」）耶和華卻使哈拿不能懷孕。

words.note: Pinyin 'yí' because '一' is followed by a 4th tone.
Refers to the Hebrew Bible text.
Pinyin 'yí' because '一' is followed by a 4th tone.

verses.text: 因為耶和華使哈拿不能懷孕，她的對頭就盡力刺激她，使她苦惱。
年年都是這樣；每逢她上耶和華殿的時候，毗尼拿總是刺激哈拿，使她哭泣，吃不下飯。
她的丈夫以利加拿對她說：「哈拿，你為甚麼哭泣？為甚麼不吃飯，為甚麼心裡難過呢？你有我不是比有十個兒子更好嗎？」

words.note: Used in rhetorical questions

verses.text: 哈拿在示羅吃喝完了，就起來。（那時以利祭司在耶和華殿的門柱旁邊，坐在椅子上。）
她心裡愁苦，就向耶和華禱告，流淚痛哭，

words.note: A common verb-object compound for 'to pray'.

verses.text: 並且許願，說：「萬軍之耶和華啊，你若是看顧使女的困苦，記念我，不忘記你的使女，賜給使女一個兒子，我就必把他一生獻給耶和華，不剃他的頭。」

words.note: Part of the epithet 'Lord of Hosts'
Hebrew name for God
A humble way for a woman to refer to herself before God or a superior.
A humble way for a woman to refer to herself before God or a superior.
賜 (cì) implies a gift from a superior to an inferior.
A humble way for a woman to refer to herself before God or a superior.
Hebrew name for God
Refers to the Nazirite vow, where one would not cut their hair.

verses.text: 哈拿向耶和華禱告了很久，以利一直在注視她的嘴。

words.note: Hebrew name for God

verses.text: 原來哈拿是在心中訴說，只見她的嘴唇在動，卻聽不見她的聲音，因此以利以為她是個喝醉了的女人。

words.note: A potential complement structure indicating inability to hear.

verses.text: 以利就對她說：「你要醉到幾時呢？快快醒過來吧！」

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes urgency.

verses.text: 哈拿回答：「我主啊，不是的。我是個心靈愁苦的婦人，淡酒烈酒都沒有喝，只不過在耶和華面前傾吐我的心意。

words.note: A respectful form of address, often for a superior.
Hebrew name for God

verses.text: 不要把你的使女看作不檢點的女子，我因為極度愁苦和激動，才一直傾訴到現在。」

words.note: Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Indicates a result or consequence after a condition.

verses.text: 以利回答：「平平安安回去吧！願以色列的 神把你向他所求的賜給你。」

words.note: A reduplicated adjective used adverbially.
Indicates suggestion or mild command.
Used to express a wish or a prayer.
Often capitalized in translation to refer to the monotheistic God.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase.
Forms a nominalized phrase 'that which is requested'.

verses.text: 哈拿說：「願你的婢女在你眼前蒙恩！」於是這婦人回去，並且吃飯，臉上再沒有愁容。

words.note: Used to express a wish or a prayer.

verses.text: 第二天，他們清早起來，在耶和華面前敬拜，然後回到他們的家鄉拉瑪，回到自己的家裡去。以利加拿和妻子哈拿同房；耶和華顧念哈拿，

words.note: Here functions as a directional complement.
Euphemism for marital relations.

verses.text: 她就懷孕；時候到了，就生了一個兒子，哈拿給他起名叫撒母耳，因為她說：「他是我從耶和華那裡求來的。」

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Indicates completion of an action or change of state.
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Indicates completion of an action.
Introduces the indirect object or beneficiary.
A common biblical construction meaning 'to give a name to (someone)'
Verb-complement construction indicating acquisition through requesting.
Forms a nominalized or descriptive phrase.

verses.text: 以利加拿和他全家都上示羅去，向耶和華獻年祭和還所許的願；

words.note: Indicates movement away from the speaker.
The Hebrew Tetragrammaton, translated 'Lord' in English Bibles.
Nominalizes the following verb.

verses.heading: Hannah Dedicates Samuel to the Lord

verses.text: 哈拿卻沒有上去，因為她對丈夫說：「等孩子斷了奶，我才帶他去朝見耶和華。他要永遠住在那裡。」

words.note: Literally 'to face and see', often used for meeting royalty or deities.

verses.text: 她丈夫以利加拿對她說：「你看怎樣好，就怎樣作吧。你可以留在這裡，等到你給孩子斷了奶，但願耶和華實現他的話。」於是哈拿留在家裡乳養孩子，直到給他斷了奶。

words.note: Indicates suggestion, agreement, or mild imperative.
Indicates the beneficiary or recipient of an action.
Expresses a strong wish or hope.
Refers to breastfeeding and nurturing a child.
Indicates the beneficiary or recipient of an action.

verses.text: 她給孩子斷了奶之後，就帶他一同上去，又帶了一頭三歲的公牛（按照《馬索拉抄本》，「一頭三歲的公牛」應作「三頭公牛」；現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯）、十公斤麵和一皮袋酒。她把孩子帶到示羅耶和華的殿那裡；那時孩子還很小。

words.note: Indicates the beneficiary or recipient of an action.
A collection of ancient Jewish texts of the Hebrew Bible.
Ancient Greek translation of the Hebrew Bible.
Modern equivalent; original unit would be 'ephah' in the Bible.
Refers to a container made of animal skin for liquids like wine.
Marks the object of a verb when it is to be acted upon.

verses.text: 他們宰了公牛以後，就帶孩子到以利那裡，
婦人說：「我主啊，我敢指著我主的性命起誓，我就是從前在這裡站在你旁邊，向耶和華禱告的那個婦人。

words.note: A title of respect, especially for God or royalty.
A title of respect, especially for God or royalty.
The Hebrew name for God.
A formal term for prayer, often in a religious context.

verses.text: 那時我祈求為要得這孩子，耶和華已經把我向他所求的賜給我了，

words.note: A formal term for requesting or imploring, often in a religious context.
The Hebrew name for God.
Forms a relative clause, indicating 'that which'.
To give something formally, usually from a superior to an inferior.

verses.text: 所以我現在把他獻給耶和華，他的一生是屬於耶和華的。」於是他就在那裡敬拜耶和華。

words.note: To present or offer something to a higher authority, often in a religious context.
The Hebrew name for God.
The Hebrew name for God.
Emphasizes possession or turns a phrase into an adjective.
To revere and adore, especially in a religious context.
The Hebrew name for God.
